urlLink I'm going camping this weekend and so I set my tent up to air it out. I think I might sleep outside tonight. It's kinda' hot out: 85 degrees. But, I think that'll make tonight very pleasant. The tent is a "Greatland" from Target (I love Target). This tent is so cool. Not because it's mine (though that helps '_'), but because it's designed well. You enter the front which is a screened in porch. From there you can take your shoes off and step into the sleeping quarters. This setup is great because by taking your shoes off outside you don't get all sorts of dirt and crap on the floor. So, now I'm living the highlife! When I camp I camp in style! :) Okay, this isn't actually my new Townhouse. I'll post some pictures of my house once my furniture arrives.

urlLink This is kind of random. I bought a Dyson vacuum a couple weeks ago for my new place and I love it so much. I don't particularly love vacuuming, but aside from that, this machine is friggin' awesome. The suction power is great, which I need because my carpet is really plush, and the extending hose and attachments are so convenient and well designed. Plus, this thing looks SO COOL! I get babes to come to my house just by telling them I have a Dyson. I usually can get them to vacuum a level for me under the guise of a "test run," its beautiful (both the strategy and the machine, the ladies aren't bad, either). Ladies, shoot me an email if you'd like to give the beast a test drive. Chauvinistic? Hey, At least I vacuum (sometimes). :) Truth be told, I don't vacuum a ton, cause I also have a Roomba (robot vacuum) - which I also love (look for comments on that machine soon). Okay, now I'm bordering on having a cleaning OCD, huh?

urlLink Here's my brother riding a bike my dad just bought. It's a Honda NSR-50. It's a scaled down crotch-rocket. It's super fun. Color wise it's nothing too beautiful, but that's because these are meant to be racing bikes and I guess Honda figures that the racers will want to give their machine custom graphic. This little baby will reach speeds of around 40 (I think), has 6 gears, and will reach 11,000 RPM's. It sounds great. For me, it's a fun little toy to tide me over until I get a full-sized motorcycle. Which I hope will be within the next couple weeks.

Well, things have been really good for me over these last few weeks. 1) I closed on my townhouse and moved in. I've been organizing and buying crap to make it look more like a home. I'll try to post pictures as soon as I get my furniture moved in and looking nice. 2) Next on my list of good things: I bought out the car I was leasing. I've been leasing it for the past ~2 years and I liked it so much that I figure that I'll keep it longer. I might post picture eventually. 3) I completed my first triathlon for the year. This has been the third year that I've been competing in organized events. I've been doing "homemade" triathlons for the past 4-5 years. Anyway, I didn't do as well this year (compared to last year), but considering that I didn't really train at all this year, I didn't do too badly. Lengths: 1/2 mile swim, 13 mile bike, 3 mile run. Time: 1:35:15.

Okay, so I suppose this isn't really a poem. I mean it doesn't rhyme or anything, and there's really no rhythm, either. I suppose it's more of a "Famous Quote" kind of thing - minus the famous part (at least, at the moment). Oh, yeah, I'll be famous some day. But, it probably won't be from my writing skills. :) You can be a runner but be too tired to walk. You can pray and feel like you aren't being heard. You can be educated and realize you don't know a thing. You can be beautiful but think you are uglier than everyone else. You can be where you want but think you should be somewhere else. You can be rich but not have enough to buy what's important to you. You can have the perfect family and think they don’t care. You can believe in God but wonder if He's really there. You can be surrounded by friends but feel all alone.

urlLink My goal is to include in every post a picture. Mostly because whenever I go to someone's blog I get bored of reading - I like the pretty pictures! Yay! Anyway, it's been awhile since I've posted anything. The reason for that is 1) I've been busy "working," 2) I need my time to play, and 3) I've been really busy studying for an Enrolled Agent exam I'm taking with my dad and brothers (and brother-in-law, and cousin(s)) in September. The EA exam is like the CPA of taxes. It's a two day test with a length of six hours per day. All on taxes (fun, huh? Actually, it kind of is). I guess the pass rate is super slim. Most people don't pass it the first time. I think one of the reasons is that there isn't a good school for it - at least not around here in Minnesota. Okay, the picture above was taken about 3-4 months ago. There's a huge burn pile in the back of my parents property and it was time to light it up. It was really windy that day. The fire was burning like crazy. If there was a dry leaf within 20 feet it would just start on fire. It was pretty intense. So, my dad had my brother run and grab all the fire extinguishers he had. After they used all of them my dad had my brother run to our next-door neighbor/cousin's house and borrow all their extinguishers. Those combined with the dying of wind caused the flames to finally get under control. I have pictures where the entire fire is covered in extinguisher exhaust because my dad is on one side and my brother is on the other side. I choose this picture because I liked the half flame half exhaust thing. Another reason I haven't posted as much is because I've been writing a more detailed journal of my life almost every day. Because of that I haven't had as much desire to write anything for my web site. That, plus, I haven't had time to take more pictures - and with my goal to always post a picture... well, you get the idea. The sad thing about writing in a journal is that I'm starting to see that my life isn't all that exciting. At least, that's what it seemed like at first. Now I'm starting to see how unique and interesting most moments are in my life. It seems like it's mostly perspective. I think I'm kind of oblivious to life just trying to enjoy everything and because of that I miss the fact that cool stuff happens. Sounds paradoxical, huh? Yeah, I'm confused too. My point is... Well, I lost it. But, I enjoy running. I think it's time to run.

urlLink I went out walking this morning to wake up so that I could study and I saw this rabbit in the yard. It just stood there as I looked at it - and I was probably only about ten feet away. So, I ran back into my office to grab my camera. When I came back outside it was gone but after looking around I ended up finding it behind the office. So, I started taking pictures - each time getting closer. I took about 20 pictures and ended up being only about two feet away. My guess is that this is the mother of the little baby rabbits we found last month. I'm assuming that since her babies were taken to a nearby park reserve she feels like she has nothing to live for. It was like she was so depressed. Maybe she thought I could take her to her babies. Sorry, momma, I don't know where they are.

urlLink I went camping in my parent's yard with my niece and nephew last night. This is a picture of them. I didn't have my camera with me last night, so this is a picture of them when our family went out to Nauvoo. We started out by watching a couple episodes of "The Muppets" on DVD. Then we brushed our teeth and climbed into the tent. It was pretty hot and humid out - but I figured it wouldn't matter that much. Nat and Bito (nicknames) wanted me to read them a book so we did that until (after about four pages) Bito said he was going to sleep. So, then we hopped into our beds and said our prayers. Things were going well (expect that my blankets felt damp from the humidity) until Bito started playing with his flashlight. I finally coaxed him into turning it off; but, then he kept talking. (I could have sworn that he wanted to go to bed!) After threats of taking him into "grandma and grandpa's" the house he quieted down for a while. After a couple minutes Bito started wrestling around. He couldn't sleep well - he said his four inch foam mattress was "bumpy." I asked if he wanted to go inside - "yes" he replied. I took him in and put him to bed then came back out to the tent - Nat was asleep. After a few minutes of dealing with uncomfortable sheets I dozed off. My "sleep" lasted about an hour - I woke up, feeling damp and uncomfortable. Finally, I decided that it sucked outside and that my bed at home was calling me. I tried to wake up Nat, but she was sound asleep. I picked her up and carried her into the house. After that I went to my house, showered, and jumped into a real bed. Ah!!!! In the morning my parents said that Nat was crying a bit because she didn't know where she was. I think I enjoy camping but on nights like last night I it sucks.
